page.title: 10MOAT FARM
page.content: On Moat Farm there are five full time workers and one student who comes to help at lambing time and harvest. In a year they use about 450 tonnes of fertiliser. There are 810 ewes and the total number of tups, ewes, gimmers and lambs is 2,700. In lambing time about 1,500 lambs are born. There are usually about 20 pet lambs without mothers. During lambing they use 10 tonnes of sheep cake when the sheep are indoors and another 8 tonnes when they are turned out. There are 130 cattle and about 430 through the system in a year. They feed about 20 to 25 tonnes of silage a year. The farm has 11 tractors 4 of which are four wheel drive. They have two combines each with an 18 foot cut.
